intro: Vellasquezia, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves and showy, often yellow or orange flowers. These plants are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Vellasquezia species are typically shrubs or small trees, often found in wetlands and along riverbanks. They play an important role in their ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various animals.
